courses.name: Introduction to Peace and Conflict Studies (formerly PCS260Y1, UNI110Y1, UNI260Y1)

cmCourseInfo.description: A review of the full range of theories explaining the nature and causes of conflict and possibilities for its resolution; provides students with a set of theoretical tools for effective analysis of interpersonal, civil, and international conflict.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to Peace and Conflict Studies (formerly PCS260Y1, UNI110Y1, UNI260Y1)
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Only for current PCJ program students in second year and higher/permission of the Program Director

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Students not in the Peace, Conflict and Justice Program must have approval from the Program Administrator to take PCJ courses. Please contact the Program Administrator at pcj.programme@utoronto.ca.

courses.name: Topics in Peace, Conflict, and Justice

cmCourseInfo.description: An in-depth exploration of selected issues in the field of Peace, Conflict, and Justice. Topics may include: negotiation theory, ethnic and inter-group identity conflict, feminist perspectives on peace, war, and justice; mathematical modeling of arms races, war, and peacemaking; decision-making theory and conflict; environmental change and conflict; global justice institutions; and traditional perspectives on statecraft.
cmCourseInfo.title: Topics in Peace, Conflict, and Justice
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: PCJ260Y1 or permission of the Program Director.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Students not in the Peace, Conflict and Justice Program must have approval from the Program Administrator to take PCJ courses. Please contact the Program Administrator at pcj.programme@utoronto.ca.

courses.name: Special Topics in Peace and Conflict Studies (formerly PCS361H1, UNI361H1)

cmCourseInfo.description: An exploration of selected issues in the field of Peace, Conflict and Justice involving an overseas and/or practicum component.
cmCourseInfo.title: Special Topics in Peace and Conflict Studies (formerly PCS361H1, UNI361H1)

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Students not in the Peace, Conflict and Justice Program must have approval from the Program Administrator to take PCJ courses. Please contact the Program Administrator at pcj.programme@utoronto.ca.

courses.name: Contemporary Issues in Peace and Conflict (formerly PCS460H1, UNI460H1)

cmCourseInfo.description: A colloquium (fall term) on selected issues in the field of Peace and Conflict Studies. Topics to be considered include planetary, ecospheric, state, societal, and human security.
cmCourseInfo.title: Contemporary Issues in Peace and Conflict (formerly PCS460H1, UNI460H1)
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: PCJ360Y1, or PCJ360H1 and PCJ362H1, or permission of the Program Director; enrolment restricted to students enrolled in Peace, Conflict and Justice Specialist program

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Students not in the Peace, Conflict and Justice Program must have approval from the Program Administrator to take PCJ courses. Please contact the Program Administrator at pcj.programme@utoronto.ca.

courses.name: Contemporary Issues in Peace and Conflict (formerly PCS461H1, UNI460Y1)

cmCourseInfo.description: A research seminar (spring term) on selected issues in the field of Peace and Conflict Studies.  Topics to be considered include planetary, ecospheric, state, societal, and human security.
cmCourseInfo.title: Contemporary Issues in Peace and Conflict (formerly PCS461H1, UNI460Y1)
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: PCJ360Y1 and PCJ460H1; enrolment restricted to students enrolled in the Peace, Conflict and Justice Specialist program

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Students not in the Peace, Conflict and Justice Program must have approval from the Program Administrator to take PCJ courses. Please contact the Program Administrator at pcj.programme@utoronto.ca.

courses.name: Peace and Conflict Studies Independent Study Course (formerly PCS499H1)

cmCourseInfo.description: Independent study in the area of Peace and Conflict Studies. It is designed to provide students with the opportunity to explore topics not covered in the curriculum, or to develop a more detailed focus on topics covered. Approval of the Program Director is required. The student must obtain the written agreement of the instructor who will supervise the independent study. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Peace and Conflict Studies Independent Study Course (formerly PCS499H1)
cmCourseInfo.recommendedPreparation: For students enrolled in the Peace, Conflict and Justice Major or Specialist program.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
